semantic_title: Psychoactive Substance Use, Abuse and Dependence Hierarchy
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 5. Chapter 5: Mental, Behavioral and Neurodevelopmental disorders > b. Mental and behavioral disorders due to psychoactive substance use > 2) Psychoactive Substance Use, Abuse and Dependence

content.full_text: When the provider documentation refers to use, abuse and dependence of the same substance (e.g. alcohol, opioid, cannabis, etc.), only one code should be assigned to identify the pattern of use based on the following hierarchy: • If both use and abuse are documented, assign only the code for abuse • If both abuse and dependence are documented, assign only the code for dependence • If use, abuse and dependence are all documented, assign only the code for dependence • If both use and dependence are documented, assign only the code for dependence. (Evidence: pg no: 43, L42-L49)
content.summary: Establishes a clear hierarchy for coding substance use disorders when multiple levels are documented, with dependence taking highest priority, followed by abuse, then use (Evidence: pg no: 43, L42-L49)
key_concepts: Single code assignment rule (Evidence: pg no: 43, L43)
Dependence priority (Evidence: pg no: 43, L45, L47, L49)
Same substance limitation (Evidence: pg no: 43, L42-L43)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign only one code when multiple levels documented for same substance (Evidence: pg no: 43, L42-L43)
detailed_rules.explanation: When provider documents multiple levels of substance involvement for the same substance, select only one code based on hierarchy (Evidence: pg no: 43, L42-L43)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use and abuse documented: assign only abuse code (Evidence: pg no: 43, L44)
detailed_rules.explanation: When both use and abuse are documented, abuse takes precedence over use (Evidence: pg no: 43, L44)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Abuse and dependence documented: assign only dependence code (Evidence: pg no: 43, L45)
detailed_rules.explanation: When both abuse and dependence are documented, dependence takes precedence over abuse (Evidence: pg no: 43, L45)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use, abuse and dependence all documented: assign only dependence code (Evidence: pg no: 43, L46-L47)
detailed_rules.explanation: When all three levels are documented, dependence takes highest precedence (Evidence: pg no: 43, L46-L47)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use and dependence documented: assign only dependence code (Evidence: pg no: 43, L48-L49)
detailed_rules.explanation: When both use and dependence are documented, dependence takes precedence over use (Evidence: pg no: 43, L48-L49)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify all documented levels for the same substance
Step 2: Apply hierarchy: dependence > abuse > use
Step 4: Assign only one code for that substance
Step 5: Repeat for each different substance if applicable
